channel.title: Media on Ashley D. Greeley
channel.description: Recent content in Media on Ashley D. Greeley

item.title: Physstudent
item.description: Physics Student Builds Space Weather Satellite Read the article at catholic.edu here! Tidbit: “Ashley Greeley is building a satellite. “I know,” said Greeley. “I tell people that and they always say, ’that sounds cool!’ — but seriously, it is really cool.” From the article

item.title: The Herky Jerky Weirdness of Earth's Magnetic Field
item.description: The Herky Jerky Weirdness of Earth’s Magnetic Field Read the article on EOS here! Tidbit: “But sometimes a satellite is just unlucky. Ashley Greeley, a postdoctoral scholar at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center, recalled a CubeSat that died shortly after launch. During start-up checks and the commissioning phase, “we think that an energetic particle hit it in the wrong place at the wrong time, and we never got data, unfortunately,” she said.
